natural solution: Let $p = \frac{x}{a},$ $q = \frac{y}{b},$ $r = \frac{z}{c}.$  Then $p + q + r = 3$ and $\frac{1}{p} + \frac{1}{q} + \frac{1}{r} = 0,$ so $pq + pr + qr = 0.$
We want $p^2 + q^2 + r^2.$  Squaring the equation $p + q + r = 3,$ we get \[p^2 + q^2 + r^2 + 2(pq + pr + qr) = 9,\]so $p^2 + q^2 + r^2 = \boxed{9}.$
